page.title: 11Honiton:translation of talk
page.content: When we came here and I was just a girl, Honiton wasn't the same as it is now, it was really only the High Street, New Street and nothing else. Now in the summer, the place is full of visitors, they are people who picnic beside he motorways to admire the view, and all they see is just more cars.... silly great idiots!! If you are left handed down here, we say you are{coochy.}We ask 'Where are you going?'or 'How are you?',to which one answers 'I am alright, how are you?', but the place is full of foreigners and you can't understand what they are saying, nor they you.
